1 CORE Deﬁnition: Lonza believes that disclosing CORE results of the Group’s performance enhances the ﬁnancial markets' understanding of the company because the CORE results enable better comparison across years. CORE results exclude exceptional expenses and income related to e.g. restructuring, environmentaI-remediation, acquisitions and divestitures, impairments and amortization of acquisition-related intangible assets, which can differ signiﬁcantly from year to year. For this same reason, Lonza uses these CORE results in addition to IFRS as important factors in internally assessing the Group’s performance. The reconcmation of IFRS to CORE results within the supplementary ﬁnancial information provides further details on the adjustments.
